title: Beef Stew with Ghoulish Mashed Potato Ghosts

ingredients.content: 30 oz stew meat, beef, cubed (approx. 1 in.)
32 oz russet potatoes, peeled, cubed (approx. ½ in.)
5 oz yellow onion, cut into pieces (approx. 1 md. onion)
3 oz carrots, cut into ¼ in. rounds (approx. 2 lg. carrots)
3 oz celery, cut into ½ in. pieces (approx. 2 stalks)
3 oz parsnips, cut into ¼ in. rounds (approx. 2 sm. parsnips)
4 oz green peas (fresh or frozen), plus 12 extra peas to make ghost eyes
4 oz fresh white button mushrooms, sliced or diced

preparations.content: Place a bowl on top of mixing bowl lid and weigh in stew meat. Add Worcestershire sauce, ground cloves, 1 tsp salt and pepper. Stir to coat beef and set aside.

<b>Insert butterfly whisk<b>. Place potatoes, milk and 1 tsp salt into mixing bowl and cook <b>30 min/195°F/speed 1<b>. Add butter and mash <b>30 sec/speed 3<b>. <b>Remove butterfly whisk.<b> Transfer mashed potatoes to a bowl, set aside and keep warm. Clean mixing bowl.
Place onion, garlic and olive oil into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and sauté <b>2 min/250°F/speed 1<b>.
Add reserved meat, carrots, celery and parsnips and cook <b>3 min/212°F/speed 1<b>.
Add flour, tomato paste, stock paste and water and cook <b>30 min/212°F//speed <b>.
Add peas, corn and mushrooms and cook <b>20 min/212°F//speed <b> until beef is tender.
Transfer into 6 bowls. Place mashed potatoes into an icing bag with a 2 inch cut base (without nozzle). Pipe ghost shapes onto stew, garnish each ghost with 2 peas for the eyes and serve immediately.
